docs.text:
Introduction


This site defines the technical specifications developed by the 
Local Waste Service Standards Project
.


Approach


Design principles


The project will follow the 
API design guidance
 from the 
Government Service Design Manual
.


Technical standards


These technical specifications are used where relevant:




The API is documented using 
RAML
.


The APIs make use of 
JSON-LD
.


Object models use 
JSON Schema
.


JSON Table Schema
 are used for table definitions.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: This site defines the technical specifications developed by the  Local Waste Service Standards Project .
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Design principles  The project will follow the  API design guidance  from the  Government Service Design Manual .  Technical standards  These technical specifications are used where relevant:   The API is documented using  RAML .  The APIs make use of  JSON-LD .  Object models use  JSON Schema .  JSON Table Schema  are used for table definitions.
docs.title: Approach

docs.text:
Data model


This gives an overview of the data model entities:










Model


Description










Waste service


A waste or recycling service provided by the council for citizens.






Round plan


A vehicle emptying containers from a set of properties on a repeating schedule.






Round


An instance of a round plan that has been executed on a particular date.






Waste event


An issue or check that is recorded during a round.






Container type


What types of containers are used by the services.






Container


Where materials are stored for collection.






Material stream


The types of materials that can be collected.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: This gives an overview of the data model entities:      Model  Description      Waste service  A waste or recycling service provided by the council for citizens.    Round plan  A vehicle emptying containers from a set of properties on a repeating schedule.    Round  An instance of a round plan that has been executed on a particular date.    Waste event  An issue or check that is recorded during a round.    Container type  What types of containers are used by the services.    Container  Where materials are stored for collection.    Material stream  The types of materials that can be collected.
docs.title: Data model

docs.text:
Waste service


Use cases and requirements


The Service model should have properties for:


name




For identification.




frequency




An indication of typically how often the collection is run.




description




For specific instructions about the service, such as when and where to put containers out, that bin lids must be closed, etc.




next collections




To know upcoming dates of when upcoming collections will happen, when filtered by property. Also if any adjustments to the scheduled dates are made.




previous collections




To know when the last few collections have taken place, when filtered by property.




container types




What types of containers (and in relation, materials) are collected by this service.




rounds




The schedules and routes of trucks collecting the materials handled by this service.




Types


This WasteService type:




Is a derivation of the 
Service concept
 in the Smart City Concept Model.


Extends from the 
GovernmentService
 schema.org type.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










name


schema:name


Name of the service.






frequency


Text


How often it runs, e.g. weekly.






description


schema:description


A short description of the service.






next collections


Date


List of dates of next collections.






previous collections


Date


List of dates of previous collections.






container types


Container type


The container types that are collected.






available channel


schema:availableChannel


A means of accessing the service (e.g. a phone bank, a web site, a location, etc.).






provider


schema:provider


The council providing the service.






service area


schema:serviceArea


The geographic area where the service is provided.






service operator


schema:serviceOperator


The operator of the service, if different to the provider.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "@type": "WasteService",
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Mixed recycling",
  "frequency": "weekly",
  "container_types": [
    {
      "@type": "ContainerType",
      "color": "black",
      "size": "240L",
      "shape": "wheelie bin",
      "lid_color": "green",
      "material_stream": {
        "name": "Mixed recyclables",
        "@id": "/waste/material-streams/mixed-recycling"
      },
      "image": ""
    },
    {
      "@type": "ContainerType",
      "color": "brown",
      "size": "40L",
      "shape": "caddy",
      "material_stream": {
        "name": "Food waste",
        "@id": "/waste/material-streams/food-waste"
      },
      "image": ""
    }
  ],
  "description": "Please put your recycling wheelie bin on the street.",
  "esd_url": "http://id.esd.org.uk/service/1130",

  "last_collection": {
    "@type": "Collection",
    "date": "23 July 2015",
    "round": "/rounds/123",
    "containers": [
      {
        "@type": "WasteContainer",
        "id": "2140541",
        "status": "in_service",
        "type": {
          "color": "black",
          "size": "240L",
          "shape": "wheelie bin",
          "lid_color": "green",
          "image": "",
          "material_streams": [
            {
              "name": "Mixed recyclables",
              "@id": "/waste/material-streams/mixed-recycling"
            }
          ]
        }
      }
    ],
    "events": [
      {
        "@type": "WasteEvent",
        "@id": "/api/events/1",
        "type": "Not presented",
        "date_created": "1 August 2015",
        "uprn": "123456789012",
        "usrn": "123456789012",
        "image": "http://example.com/images/123.png",
        "geo": {
          "@type": "GeoCoordinates",
          "latitude": "40.75",
          "longitude": "73.98"
        },
        "container_color": "black"
      }
    ]
  },
  "next_collection": {
    "@type": "Collection",
    "date": "1 August 2014",
    "changed_date": "2 August 2015",
    "changed_date_reason": "Bank holiday",
    "containers": [
      {
        "@type": "WasteContainer",
        "id": "2140541",
        "status": "in_service",
        "type": {
          "color": "black",
          "size": "240L",
          "shape": "wheelie bin",
          "lid_color": "green",
          "image": "",
          "material_streams": [
            {
              "name": "Mixed recyclables",
              "@id": "/waste/material-streams/mixed-recycling"
            }
          ]
        }
      }
    ]
  },
  "available_channel": {
    "@type": "ServiceChannel",
    "name": "Household waste and street maintenance",
    "service_phone": {
      "@type": "ContactPoint",
      "telephone": "0123456789",
      "email": "waste@example.gov.uk"
    },
    "service_url": "http://www.example.gov.uk/waste"
  },
  "provider": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Example Council",
    "url": "http://www.example.gov.uk"
  },
  "service_area": {
    "@type": "AdministrativeArea",
    "name": "Anytown"
  },
  "service_operator": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Example Waste Operator Co"
  }
}

Also if any adjustments to the scheduled dates are made.   previous collections   To know when the last few collections have taken place, when filtered by property.   container types   What types of containers (and in relation, materials) are collected by this service.   rounds   The schedules and routes of trucks collecting the materials handled by this service.

docs.title: Codelists

docs.text:
Round plan


Use cases and requirements


The Round plan model should have properties for:


containers




What containers at properties the round will collect from.




start date




When rule starts.




repeating rule




How often the round is run.




exceptions




When dates are exceptions to the repeating rule.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










containers


List of 
containers


The list of containers at properties that will be emptied.






start date


schema:startDate


When this plan started.






repeating rule


string


How often a round is executed based on the plan. Typically weekly or fortnightly on a specific day of the week.






exceptions


List of 
Date


Dates removed from the repeating rule.






additions


List of 
Date


Extra dates not part of the repeating rule.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "@id": "/round-plans/1",
  "@type": "RoundPlan",
  "start_date": "",
  "rrule": "",
  "containers": "/api/containers?round_plan=1"
}
docs.title: Round plan

docs.text: The Round plan model should have properties for:  containers   What containers at properties the round will collect from.   start date   When rule starts.   repeating rule   How often the round is run.   exceptions   When dates are exceptions to the repeating rule.

docs.text: Term  Mapping  Definition      containers  List of  containers  The list of containers at properties that will be emptied.    start date  schema:startDate  When this plan started.    repeating rule  string  How often a round is executed based on the plan. Typically weekly or fortnightly on a specific day of the week.    exceptions  List of  Date  Dates removed from the repeating rule.    additions  List of  Date  Extra dates not part of the repeating rule.

docs.title: Serialisation

docs.text:
Round


Use cases and requirements


The Round model should have properties for:


name




An identifier for this round.




date




When this round took place.




round plan




A reference to which Round plan was used.




events




Any related events that have been recorded.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










name


schema:name


Identifer for the round.






date


Date


When the round took place.






round plan


Round plan


The round plan this round is based on.






events


List of 
Events


Events that happened on the round.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "@id": "/rounds/456",
  "date": "",
  "plan": {
    "id": "",
    "start_date": "",
    "rrule": "",
    "containers": "/api/containers?round_plan=1"
  },
  "events": "/api/events?round=456"
}
docs.title: Round

docs.text: The Round model should have properties for:  name   An identifier for this round.   date   When this round took place.   round plan   A reference to which Round plan was used.   events   Any related events that have been recorded.

docs.text: Term  Mapping  Definition      name  schema:name  Identifer for the round.    date  Date  When the round took place.    round plan  Round plan  The round plan this round is based on.    events  List of  Events  Events that happened on the round.

Serialisation

docs.text:
Container type


Use cases and requirements


The Container type model should have properties for:


color




The general color.




size




Typically in litres.




shape




Wheelie bin, box, caddy, etc.




lid color




In case its different to the body color.




disposable




If the container type is disposable or one-time use, e.g. a bag.




material stream




What kind of waste the container is used for.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










id




Unique identifer.






color


schema:color


General color as a hex value.






size


integer


Size in litres.






shape


text


The shape or type of the container.






lid color


schema:color


Lid-specific color as a hex value.






disposable


boolean


If container is disposable.






material stream


Material stream


The materials used.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "color": "#fff",
  "shape": "wheelie bin",
  "size": "240",
  "reusable": true,
  "material_stream": {
    "name": "mixed recyclables",
    "@id": "/api/material-streams/mixed-recyclables"
  }
}

    

  






Codelists


Container shape

docs.text:
Container


Use cases and requirements


The Container model should have properties for:


container type




For the common properties of the container.




serial number or ID




For identification of the container.




UPRN




To link to its property.




status




Capture whether in-use, damaged, etc.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










id


string


Unique identifer.






type


Container type


The type of container.






status


string


The status of the container.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "type": "",
  "uprn": "123456789",
  "serial_number": "ABCD1234"
}

    

  






Codelists


Status




in service


damaged

docs.title: Codelists

docs.text:
Waste event


Use cases and requirements


The Event model should have properties for:


event type




What kind of event it is.




start date




Know when an event happened.




UPRN




For recording against specific properties.




USRN




For recording street-level events.




coordinates




For easy geolocation of where the event was recorded.




image




Visual evidence of an issue.




comments




For any additional information useful to record.




round




The round where this event happened.




container type




What kind of container does the event relate to? This could be typically matched by colour.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










type


string


A categorisation of the event.






start date


schema:startDate


When the event was took place.






uprn


string


A unique identifier for a property.






usrn


string


A unique identifier for a street.






geo


schema:geo


The location in WGS84 datum.






image


schema:image


A URL to a related image.






round


URL


The URL of the round where this event was recorded.






container_type


Container type


The type of container, if relevant.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "@type": "WasteEvent",
  "@id": "/api/events/1",
  "type": "Not presented",
  "date_created": "2014-05-23T20:00",
  "uprn": "123456789012",
  "usrn": "123456789012",
  "image": "http://example.com/images/123.png",
  "geo": {
    "@type": "GeoCoordinates",
    "latitude": "40.75",
    "longitude": "73.98"
  },
  "round": "/rounds/123",
  "container_type": {
    "color": "#fff",
    "shape": "wheelie bin",
    "size": "240",
    "reusable": true,
    "material_stream": {
      "name": "mixed recyclables",
      "@id": "/api/material-streams/mixed-recyclables"
    }
  }
}
docs.title: Waste event

USRN   For recording street-level events.   coordinates   For easy geolocation of where the event was recorded.   image   Visual evidence of an issue.   comments   For any additional information useful to record.   round   The round where this event happened.   container type   What kind of container does the event relate to? This could be typically matched by colour.

docs.title: Serialisation

docs.text:
Material stream


Use cases and requirements


The Material stream model should have properties for:


name




What kind of material it is.




image




For clear identification, matching physical signage.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










name


string


The name of the material.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "name": "Mixed recycling",
  "color": "fd8812",
  "image": "http://example.com/images/mixed-recycling.png"
}
docs.title: Material stream

docs.text: The Material stream model should have properties for:  name   What kind of material it is.   image   For clear identification, matching physical signage.
docs.title: Use cases and requirements

docs.text: Term  Mapping  Definition      name  string  The name of the material.
docs.title: Properties

docs.text:
JSON Schema 
     JSON 
   

   
   
     
     
     
       {
  "name": "Mixed recycling",
  "color": "fd8812",
  "image": "http://example.com/images/mixed-recycling.png"
}
docs.title: Serialisation

docs.text:
Place


Use cases and requirements


The Address model should have properties for:


address fields


e.g. street, locality, country, postcode.




To provide basic address information that everyone understands.




UPRN




To link an address to the property universal ID.




USRN




To identify the street where the property is located.




geo




To be able to plot locations on maps.




Types


This maps to the schema.org Place type with some extended fields.


Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










address


schema:address


Physical address of the item.






uprn


Text


A unique identifier for a property.






usrn


Text


A unique identifier for a street.






geo


schema:geo


The location in WGS84 datum.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "@type": "Place",
  "@id": "/places/1",
  "address": {
    "street_address": "1 Acacia Avenue",
    "locality": "Anytown",
    "region": "Anyshire",
    "postcode": "AB1 2CD"
  },
  "geo": {
    "@type": "GeoCoordinates",
    "latitude": "40.75",
    "longitude": "73.98"
  },
  "uprn": "123456789012",
  "usrn": "123456789012"
}

UPRN   To link an address to the property universal ID.   USRN   To identify the street where the property is located.   geo   To be able to plot locations on maps.

Serialisation

docs.text:
Missed collections reasons


The table below lists a set of common possible events that can occur during a waste collection round.


Many council classifications also divide event types by the service or container type. It is assumed here that it will be possible to categorise the events by:




container type


property or street









  

  
Term

  
Sub-term

  
Description

  
Type
1

  






  

  
Not presented

  

  
The container was not presented on the street.

  
service

  






  

  
Incorrectly presented

  

  

  
service

  






  

  
Too heavy

  

  
The container was too heavy to empty.

  
service

  






  

  
Excess waste

  

  
There is too much waste to collect.

  
service

  






  

  

  
Lid open

  
The container was too full, the lid would not close properly.

  
service

  






  

  

  
Side waste present

  
Extra refuse was present at the side of the bins.

  
service

  






  

  
Contaminated

  

  
The contents was contaminated.

  
service

  






  

  

  
Food waste

  
Contaminated with food waste

  
service

  






  

  

  
Garden waste

  
Contaminated with garden waste

  
service

  






  

  

  
Refuse waste

  
Contaminated with refuse waste

  
service

  






  

  

  
Bulky waste

  
Contaminated with bulky waste

  
service

  






  

  

  
Rubble/DIY

  
Contaminated with rubble

  
service

  






  

  

  
Commercial

  
Contaminated with commercial waste

  
service

  






  

  

  
Turf/soil

  
Contaminated with turf or soil

  
service

  






  

  

  
Animal bedding

  
Contaminated with animal bedding

  
service

  






  

  
Inaccessible container store

  

  
It was not possible to access the bins.

  
service

  






  

  
Damaged

  

  
A bin was damaged.

  
service

  






  

  
Container lost in vehicle

  

  
A bin was lost inside the vehicle.

  
service

  






  

  
Not on scheme

  

  
The property was not on the service.

  
service

  






  

  
Inaccessible road

  

  
The road could not be accessed.

  
service

  






  

  
Road closure

  

  
The road was closed.

  
service

  






  

  
Querying assisted

  

  

  
service

  






  

  
Risk of injury

  

  
The containers are in the wrong location, a dog made access difficult, etc.

  

  






  

  
Street completed

  

  
All properties on this street have been visited.

  
general

  






  

  
Blocked by vehicles

  

  
A street cannot be accessed due to vehicles blocking access.

  
general

  






  

  
Roadworks

  

  
Roadworks are blocking the street.

  
general

  






  

  
Gate locked

  

  
A street cannot be accessed due to a gate being locked.

  
general

  






  

  
Part access

  

  

  
general

  






  

  
Partly completed street

  

  

  
general

  






  

  
Alarm activated

  

  
A vehicle alarm was activated.

  
general

  






  

  
Breakdown

  

  
The waste collection truck broke down.

  
general

  










Here "service" means an event type that is applied to a specific service, e.g. refuse, recycling, etc and often relates to the containers. "General" is for event types where the event is not specifically tied to a service but could affect any service
docs.title: Missed collections

docs.text:
The table below lists a set of common possible events that can occur during a waste collection round.  Many council classifications also divide event types by the service or container type. It is assumed here that it will be possible to categorise the events by:   container type  property or street     
   
   Term 
   Sub-term 
   Description 
   Type 1 
     
   
   Not presented 
   
   The container was not presented on the street. 
   service 
     
   
   Incorrectly presented 
   
   
   service 
     
   
   Too heavy 
   
   The container was too heavy to empty. 
   service 
     
   
   Excess waste 
   
   There is too much waste to collect. 
   service 
     
   
   
   Lid open 
   The container was too full, the lid would not close properly. 
   service 
     
   
   
   Side waste present 
   Extra refuse was present at the side of the bins. 
   service 
     
   
   Contaminated 
   
   The contents was contaminated. 
   service 
     
   
   
   Food waste 
   Contaminated with food waste 
   service 
     
   
   
   Garden waste 
   Contaminated with garden waste 
   service 
     
   
   
   Refuse waste 
   Contaminated with refuse waste 
   service 
     
   
   
   Bulky waste 
   Contaminated with bulky waste 
   service 
     
   
   
   Rubble/DIY 
   Contaminated with rubble 
   service 
     
   
   
   Commercial 
   Contaminated with commercial waste 
   service 
     
   
   
   Turf/soil 
   Contaminated with turf or soil 
   service 
     
   
   
   Animal bedding 
   Contaminated with animal bedding 
   service 
     
   
   Inaccessible container store 
   
   It was not possible to access the bins. 
   service 
     
   
   Damaged 
   
   A bin was damaged. 
   service 
     
   
   Container lost in vehicle 
   
   A bin was lost inside the vehicle. 
   service 
     
   
   Not on scheme 
   
   The property was not on the service. 
   service 
     
   
   Inaccessible road 
   
   The road could not be accessed. 
   service 
     
   
   Road closure 
   
   The road was closed. 
   service 
     
   
   Querying assisted 
   
   
   service 
     
   
   Risk of injury 
   
   The containers are in the wrong location, a dog made access difficult, etc. 
   
     
   
   Street completed 
   
   All properties on this street have been visited. 
   general 
     
   
   Blocked by vehicles 
   
   A street cannot be accessed due to vehicles blocking access. 
   general 
     
   
   Roadworks 
   
   Roadworks are blocking the street. 
   general 
     
   
   Gate locked 
   
   A street cannot be accessed due to a gate being locked. 
   general 
     
   
   Part access 
   
   
   general 
     
   
   Partly completed street 
   
   
   general 
     
   
   Alarm activated 
   
   A vehicle alarm was activated. 
   general 
     
   
   Breakdown 
   
   The waste collection truck broke down. 
   general 
       Here "service" means an event type that is applied to a specific service, e.g. refuse, recycling, etc and often relates to the containers. "General" is for event types where the event is not specifically tied to a service but could affect any service

docs.title: Material streams

docs.text:
Container types


The table below lists standard names for typical waste containers.








Name


Description


Image
1










bin


A typical round container with a lid.








wheeled bin


A tall plastic bin with 2 or 4 wheels.








box


55-60L box typically for certain recycling streams.








caddy


A small box with a handle typically for food waste.








sack


Loose reusable sack.








clear bag


Loose disposable bag.










1
Some of this material has been reproduced from the website 
www.partners.wrap.org.uk
 of The Waste and Resources Action Programme.
docs.title: Container types

docs.title: Container types

docs.text:
Waste Services API


Introduction


This API offers a core set of resources and operations for interacting with local council waste and recycling services.


ESD Standards


The 
ESD Standards
 define all the categories of services that local authorities typically provide. These will be referenced via URL from the Services API, to allow individual council instances of a service to be matched to common service definitions.


Services




Get a list of waste services



  
get

  
/services







Get a single service



  
get

  
/services/{serviceId}

Events




Get a list of events



  
get

  
/events





Query parameters








Name


Type


Description










page


number








uprn


string


Limit results to those related to the property with this UPRN.






usrn


string


Limit results to those related to the street with this USRN.






type


string


Limit results to those with a matching type, e.g. "Not presented".






start_date


date


Limit results to those created on or after this start date.






end_date


date


Limit results to those created before this end date.






round


string


Limit results to those recorded against this round.

docs.title: Waste Services

docs.text: This API offers a core set of resources and operations for interacting with local council waste and recycling services.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: The  ESD Standards  define all the categories of services that local authorities typically provide. These will be referenced via URL from the Services API, to allow individual council instances of a service to be matched to common service definitions.

Services
Events
Round plans
Rounds
Material streams

/places

docs.title: Places
Places

docs.text:
Data formats


Tabular data formats are defined as 
JSON Table Schema
.


Round plans


Round plan data should be formatted into a CSV file matching the format defined by the Round plan table schema. The CSV fields are listed below:





  
Name

  
Type

  
Required

  
Description






  
UPRN

  
integer

  
Yes 

  
The Unique Property Reference Number for the location.

  






  
Round plan

  
string

  
Yes 

  
An identifier for a round plan, or set of properties visited by a crew.

  






  
Container type

  
string

  
Yes 

  
The type of container at the property or place.

  






  
Schedule

  
string

  
Yes 

  
For example, alternate weekly on Monday.

  








Table schema


Here is the table schema in full:



  
{
  "fields": [
    {
      "name": "uprn",
      "title": "UPRN",
      "type": "integer",
      "description": "The Unique Property Reference Number for the location.",
      "constraints": {
        "required": true
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "round_plan",
      "title": "Round plan",
      "type": "string",
      "description": "An identifier for a round plan, or set of properties visited by a crew.",
      "constraints": {
        "required": true
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "container_type",
      "title": "Container type",
      "type": "string",
      "description": "The type of container at the property or place.",
      "constraints": {
        "required": true
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "schedule",
      "title": "Schedule",
      "type": "string",
      "description": "For example, alternate weekly on Monday.",
      "constraints": {
        "required": true
      }
    }
  ]
}
